noun.description: A man's short close-fitting padded jacket, commonly worn from the 14th to the 17th century.
examples: they were wearing red velvet doublets and hose

noun.description: A pair of similar things, in particular either of two words of the same historical source, but with two different stages of entry into the language and different resultant meanings, for example fashion and faction, cloak and clock.

origin: Middle English: from Old French, something folded, also denoting a fur-lined coat, from double double.
